play off.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if people or teams play off, they play the last game in a sports competition, in order to decide who is the winner
play off.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The top two teams will play off at Twickenham for the county title.
play off.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to deliberately use a fact, action, idea etc in order to make what you are doing better or to get an advantage
play off.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The two musicians played off each other in a piece of inspired improvisation.
play off.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a game played to decide who will win after a previous game has ended with two teams or players having equal points
play off.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a game, usually one of a series of games, played by the best teams or players in a competition in order to decide the final winner
play off.translation[1].definitions[1].e: The Lakers will meet the Bulls in the playoffs.
